questions.stem: What does a red octagonal sign mean?

choices.text: Slow down and proceed with caution

questions.explanation: A red octagonal sign is a stop sign. You must come to a complete stop before the stop line or crosswalk, or before entering the intersection if there is no stop line.

questions.stem: What color and shape are warning signs?
questions.explanation: Warning signs are diamond-shaped with black letters or symbols on a yellow background. They alert you to potential hazards ahead.

questions.stem: What should you do when you see a yellow traffic light?

choices.text: Speed up to get through the intersection
Stop if you can do so safely
Ignore it and continue driving normally

questions.explanation: A yellow light means caution. If you can safely stop, you should do so. If you are too close to stop safely, you may proceed through the intersection.

questions.stem: At a four-way stop, who has the right-of-way?

choices.text: The vehicle making a left turn
The vehicle with the most passengers

questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, the first vehicle to arrive has the right-of-way. If two vehicles arrive at the same time, the vehicle on the right goes first.

questions.stem: What should you do when an emergency vehicle approaches with lights and sirens?

choices.text: Speed up to get out of the way quickly
Pull over to the right and stop
Honk your horn to alert other drivers

questions.explanation: When an emergency vehicle approaches with lights and sirens, pull over to the right side of the road and stop. Stay stopped until the emergency vehicle passes.

questions.stem: When must you stop for a school bus?

choices.text: When the bus displays flashing red lights
Only when the bus is moving

questions.explanation: You must stop when a school bus stops and displays flashing red lights. This applies on all roads except divided highways with a median.

questions.stem: What do speed limit signs indicate?

choices.text: The minimum speed you must travel
The maximum legal speed under ideal conditions
The recommended speed for the road
The speed limit only at night

questions.explanation: Speed limit signs show the maximum legal speed allowed under ideal conditions. You must never exceed the posted speed limit.

questions.stem: What does a yield sign mean?

choices.text: Slow down and be ready to stop if necessary

questions.explanation: A yield sign means you must slow down and be ready to stop if necessary. Let other traffic go first if there is a conflict.

questions.stem: When turning left at an intersection, who must you yield to?

choices.text: Oncoming traffic going straight or turning right
No one - you have the right-of-way

questions.explanation: When turning left at an intersection, you must yield to oncoming traffic going straight or turning right. Wait for a safe gap before making your turn.

questions.stem: What does a green arrow signal mean?

choices.text: You can turn in that direction
You cannot turn in that direction

questions.explanation: A green arrow means you can turn in that direction. This allows specific movements when the main light might be red.

questions.stem: What is the general rule for following distance?

choices.text: Stay 1-2 seconds behind the vehicle in front
Stay 3-4 seconds behind the vehicle in front
Stay as close as possible to save space
Stay 10 seconds behind the vehicle in front

questions.explanation: The general rule is to stay at least 3-4 seconds behind the vehicle in front of you. In bad weather, increase this distance.

questions.stem: What is one of the most common traffic violations?
questions.explanation: Speeding is one of the most common violations. Even going 5 mph over the limit can result in a ticket and points on your license.

questions.stem: What color are guide signs that provide directional information?
questions.explanation: Green signs provide directional information for highways and major roads. They show route numbers, destinations, and distances.

questions.stem: At a T-intersection, who has the right-of-way?

choices.text: Vehicles turning onto the through road
The vehicle with the most passengers

questions.explanation: At a T-intersection, vehicles on the through road have the right-of-way over vehicles turning onto the through road.

questions.stem: What is the typical speed limit in a school zone when children are present?
questions.explanation: School zones have reduced speed limits when children are present. These limits are usually 15-25 mph to protect children's safety.

questions.stem: What should you do when you see a flashing red light?

choices.text: Speed up to get through quickly

questions.explanation: Flashing red lights mean stop, then proceed when safe. Treat them like a stop sign.

questions.stem: How far in advance should you signal before turning or changing lanes?
questions.explanation: Signal at least 100 feet before turning or changing lanes. This gives other drivers time to react to your intentions.

questions.stem: How many points can lead to license suspension in California?
questions.explanation: In California, getting 4 points in 12 months, 6 points in 24 months, or 8 points in 36 months can result in license suspension.

questions.stem: What should you do if you're in an intersection when an emergency vehicle approaches?

choices.text: Stay in the intersection and wait
Clear the intersection first, then pull over
Speed up to get out of the way
Honk your horn to alert the emergency vehicle

questions.explanation: If you're in an intersection when an emergency vehicle approaches, clear the intersection first, then pull over to the side of the road.

questions.stem: What do blue traffic signs indicate?

choices.text: Services like gas stations and hospitals

questions.explanation: Blue signs indicate services like gas stations, restaurants, and hospitals. They help you find necessary services while driving.
